hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Ibn Abbas: The Prophet ﷺ said: None shall enter Paradise through his deeds. It was said: Not even you, O Messenger of Allah? He replied: Not even me, except that Allah covers me with His mercy. The commentary states: It means Allah clothes me with His mercy and envelops me with it just as a sword is sheathed in its scabbard.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Ibn Abbas: Whoever lies deliberately upon me, let him take his seat in the Fire. This was said regarding Abdullah ibn Abi Ja'dah who came to Thaqif claiming to have a garment from the Prophet ﷺ, asking permission to choose any house he wished. When they gave him permission, he then asked for permission to choose any of their women. They refused, saying their custom with the Prophet ﷺ forbids adultery. They sent a messenger to the Prophet ﷺ who became very angry and ordered two men to kill and burn him. The man left on a rainy night and was bitten by a snake which killed him, and the messengers burned him. This is why the Prophet ﷺ said: Whoever lies upon me, let him take his seat in the Fire.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Anas ibn Malik: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ was neither excessively tall nor extremely short, not very white nor dark brown, neither having tightly curled hair nor straight hair. Allah sent him at the age of forty, he remained in Makkah for ten years and in Madinah for ten years, and Allah took him while he was sixty years old. There were not twenty white hairs in his head and beard. (Second part:) Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, was married to the Prophet ﷺ when she was six years old, and he consummated the marriage when she was nine years old. She was the only virgin he married from among his wives. She died after him having lived for forty-eight years. She died during the time of Mu'awiyah in Ramadan of the year fifty-eight. Abu Hurayrah led the prayer over her and she was buried in al-Baqi.

hadiths.english_translation: Abu Ubaydah said: Hayyan ibn Umarah said: I heard Abdullah ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with him, saying in the Sacred Mosque: Jabir ibn Zayd is the most knowledgeable of people concerning divorce. When Jabir ibn Zayd died, the news reached Anas ibn Malik, and he said: The most knowledgeable person on earth has died, or the best of the people of earth has died. Abu Ubaydah (says:) Anas was ill at that time, and both Anas ibn Malik and Jabir ibn Zayd died in the same week in the year ninety-three of the Hijra.
